summary: This is an email chain between FBI agents discussing the logistics of serving a grand jury subpoena to Leslie Wexner in Ohio as part of the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking investigation. It provides background on the case, including Epstein's arrest, the nature of the criminal conduct, and Wexner's potential role as a witness.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation, arrested and charged with sex trafficking of minor girls and conspiracy. The email describes his method of operation involving massages that escalated to sexual acts.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Described as a long-time friend, associate, and business partner of Jeffrey Epstein. The FBI plans to serve him with a grand jury subpoena to inquire about his relationship with Epstein and knowledge of Epstein's interactions with young girls.

connections.description: Described as having a decades-long business relationship and being long-time friends and associates.
The FBI agent (SA) is involved in the investigation and logistics related to serving a subpoena in the case against Epstein.

events.title: FBI Coordination on Subpoena Service
events.description: FBI agents in New York and the Criminal Investigative Division coordinate via email on logistics for serving a grand jury subpoena to Leslie Wexner in Ohio.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest and Charging
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein has been arrested and charged in the Southern District of New York with sex trafficking of minor girls and conspiracy. The charges relate to conduct in New York and Florida.

events.title: Epstein's Criminal Conduct Period
events.description: For many years, including the early-mid 2000s, Epstein enticed dozens to hundreds of underage girls to engage in sexual activity with him in exchange for money at his properties.

events.title: Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Epstein previously received a non-prosecution agreement from the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI in Florida for some of his conduct there, which is noted as not applying to the SDNY charges.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was charged in the SDNY with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy, facing up to 45 years in prison.
Epstein's modus operandi involved luring underage girls with offers of paid massages ($200-$300) which he would escalate into sexual acts, and he used victims as recruiters to bring him new girls.
The FBI was actively serving grand jury subpoenas, including one to Leslie Wexner, to gather information on Epstein's relationships and knowledge of his activities with young girls.
The document notes Epstein's prior non-prosecution agreement in Florida does not shield him from the SDNY charges, which cover conduct beyond that agreement's scope.
The email chain demonstrates inter-office FBI coordination (New York and CI Division) on witness approach and subpoena service in a high-profile case.
